Exaggerate: The claim of receiving pre-marked ballots for Joe Biden is exaggerated, as there is no evidence to support this allegation.
Lack enough support: The claim lacks sufficient evidence or support to substantiate the allegation of pre-marked ballots being sent to Queens voters.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that the pre-filled out ballot received by one voter represents a widespread issue, which is not supported by evidence.
Exist alternative explanation: The New York City Board of Elections provides an alternative explanation for the pre-filled ballot, stating that it was a result of an error made by the voter.
Contradict fact: The claim contradicts the fact that the pre-marked ballot was filled out by a human, as confirmed by the New York City Board of Elections.
Falters at times: The claim falters in providing accurate information, as it relies on a single incident to make a broader allegation without sufficient evidence.
Understate: There is no evidence to suggest that the claim is understating any facts or information.
